intro: Quercus guayabalana, commonly known as Guayabalán, is a species of oak native to Central America. It is characterized by its broad, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter on the underside. The plant produces small, acorn-like fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. The wood of Quercus guayabalana is durable and has been traditionally used by indigenous communities for construction and crafts.
